data.title: Universidad Politècnica de Valencia (UPV)
data.text:
Valencia

The Universidad Politècnica de Valencia is very well known in Spain in the field of engineering.

Moreover, internationalization is the basis of its educational project.

The Universidad Politècnica de Valencia is a university founded in 1968 that has various teaching centers in the following localities: Valencia, Gandia and Alcoy.

This university counts with 30317 students.

The Universidad Politècnica de Valencia is divided into 3 campuses: Valencia (Campus de la Vera), Alcoy and Gandía

The UPV has sports facilities: soccer stadiums, athletics track, swimming pool, gymnasium, tennis, volleyball, velodrome.

Learn more aboutstudying at public universities in Spain

Enroll at theUniversidad Politècnica de Valencia (UPV)

To apply to the Universidad Politècnica de Valencia, please send an e-mail to info@feeduc.eu.

Access to the Universidad politècnica de Valencia

The Universidad Politècnica de Valencia is divided into 4 main campuses:

Campus de la Vera - Camino de Vera, s/n

46022 ValenciaThe Campus de la Vera is the main campus of the university. It is located in the north of the city of Valencia in a quiet environment surrounded by gardens. More than 60 buildings are neatly distributed around the Agora, the heart of university life. The green areas exceed 108,000 m2 and include an outdoor sculpture museum. Sports facilities include an indoor swimming pool, a sports hall, a gym, an athletics track, a trinquete, a velodrome, several tennis and paddle courts ... And it has all the facilities necessary to provide quality higher education.

Alcoy Campus - Plaza Ferrándiz y Carbonell, s/n

03801 Alcoy

Campus Gandía - C/ Paranimf, 1

46730 Grao de Gandia, Gandia

Where to stay during your studies in Spain?

We invite you to use the following real estate platforms:

www.idealista.com

www.fotocasa.es

Please note: these platforms put you in contact with individuals and agencies. A good command of Spanish is necessary. And beware of overly attractive offers that may be scams.

To book an appointment, you need to have an account.

Free support throughout the study process

Free assistance in obtaining the Credencial UNED, a compulsory document for studying in Spain. This service is only offered when the project is fully monitored, in compliance with the site's general terms and conditions.
